You have her here locked away.


It took you awhile but it all payed.


You took little joy in what you did.


But now she was yours and it was all finished.


She lays against the wall, mind confused, she can't recall.


You would let her rest as time would come.


To make amends, to have some fun.


Tape's you remembered.


Tape's to make her laugh.


Tape to make her quiet.


Tape that scared her so fast.

Boxes lay in the basement, filled with treasures, reminders, regrets.


Photos of the scene of what transpired, all of your family that would conspire.


The looks that they would give, after what you did.


Fines and Letters, piled neatly together.


Then and Now, you couldn't handle it, now its all gone.


At the very bottom lie the photos of her.


New ones would be took, the hard part would have to come first.

Tape to cover her mouth.


Tapes for her to watch.


You couldn't have both, but one would have to do.


No one can know, she may never tell.


She would never tell.


Maybe taping her eyes, you don't want to see the tears anymore.

Time fixed things.


Things that you feared. 


Things that made her cry.


Even with the black eye.


You can't take it back.


You know what you did.


She hates you now.


But when was it ever different?


"Time would fix things."


What Bullshit.

Time came. 


So did the investigations.


The knocks on the door.


The search of the house.


The confusion of the emptiness.


Just a sad man alone.


You knew it would come, and you hid her away.


Now it called for a time of change.


You went to her after days of silence.


Yet you know there would be no silence.


Chains rattled as she let out a scream.


She still had spark, even with her life in seams.


You barked and barked for her to quit.


Yet she continued, spit coming from her lip.

Bruises, bruises on her face.


On her cheeks.


So came shrieks.


Remorse was something long gone.


You took the path.


It came with wrath.


Obedience was the key.

Each day was not okay.


You thought things would change.


betwixt the slaps and kisses.


There was no fixing the ditches.


You saw it in her eyes.


Daddy's girl had gone and died.

The slaps ceased.


For the reasons of peace.


Peace that was never to come.


She would go for the throat, wishing for a gun.


Mistakes were made.


Mistakes were made.


Made the mistakes by the man who wished,that things could have been been met with love and kisses.

Each day you sought for a future.


A future that included the forgiveness of kin.


But that was something that could only be wished.


The day she managed to slip from the chain.


bringing the makeshift shank to your shin.


She grabbed the key and ran for the steps.


Still not being able to end it with a singe slit.


you lay there incapacitated and unable to move.


It was time for something new.


You dragged yourself to the drawer.


Knowing the men would be back.


Triumph looks, guns in hand.


Chambered was the round inside the glock.


 

Cocked and ready you took the shot. 


"The end doesn't justify the means."

Now that the men have come and gone.


It was time to get her to accept this all.


The look in her eyes when you told her they left.


Hopes of rescue theft and dead.

Embarrassed and ashamed of what you did.


You took extra care in future actions you would commit.


Even so each touch came a shudder.


A yelp.


A cry.


A wish to die.

How.


How could you make someone love you again.


After beating them, in senseless sin.


A question that had to be found.


But some things are lost.


Never to be found.

They said you were evil.


A man born in hell.


A father to girl who should have been well.


They blamed you, and blamed you. 


Cutting off ties.


Hoping and wishing for their son to die.

Could you forgive someone?


Someone who was careless. 


Someone who had sinned.


You prayed for religion to forgive your shame.


In the irony that you would end up in flames.


For you knew this fantasy you were living, trying to keep this girl from living.

She lay dead.


Slumped against the wall.


Gun still warm.


One bullet in all.


Again you were alone.


Alone once more.


Only a hollow shell of a man built for so much more.


 

You raise the gun.


Softly against the head.


Of someone everyone wished dead.


"Guns."

Her eyes had layers of fear.


Fear of the truth.


Fear of the unknown.


You sit next to her.


Giving a warm smile.


She shudders away.


Muttering of mom.

To what once gave her light.


You tried to bring it back in chats.


Though she relentlessly spat.


you guess you couldn't blame her.


What could you do to see her smile.


You give her a hug.


"Do you still love me?"


She shrugs you off.

"You still loved her! I gave you everything."


"You took her away."


"It was the only way you would stay."


"To think I would stay."


"You will stay."


She looks away.


Tears on her face.

Questions she asked.


Answers she received.


Still confused about your intentions.


As if there was more to your deeds.


All you wanted was her.


Simple as it was.


Hard for her to believe.


Hard for them to believe.


To think you had sinister intentions.


How evil could you be?

The questions continued.


The answers stopped.


Once again she was locked up.


Isolation, Isolation.


There was no end.


 

So it was that she went mad.


Wishing her dad to come back.

She would not eat.


She would not drink.


She sat in the corner and continued to weep.


You stopped answering her.


So she went mad.


So funny, yet so sad.

"Sam, are you ok?"


Nothing is said, her face is blank.


This is how it is.


Her mind long gone.


Your mind long gone.


The death of her mom is what started it all.

You two left that house behind and drove to the place where her mom resides.


Her eyes and legs still in binds.


A reminder of what happened that faithful night.


The drive is quiet, the moonlight is nice.


You carry her, to the grave of the dead.


The lake, where you dumped her head.


It's then that you take off the binds.


And lay down the basket, blanket at hand.


Food is placed.


Drinks are served.


She eats quietly, not muttering a word.


"Sorry Sam." Is all you say.


She continues eating what's on her plate.


"I taught you how to drive, so you'll be fine."  You toss her the keys to your ride.


After the meal is done, she gets up, with only blank eyes.


She grabs the keys and walks to the car.


Never looking back, never stopping in her tracks.


It's then that you get up and let out a yawn.


You start walking, the water reaching your legs.


"I'll be seeing you bitch." and with that it ends.


"Shock and Awe."

Mad as she was in the situation she was in.


She didn't seemed threatened which was a step towards bliss.


You did your best to make her feel warm.


Inside this basement dorm she would call home.


You brought down a T.V and fed her well.


You tried to make the best of things without letting her out of the cell.


Her crying stopped so that was good too.


But the dead eyes made your soul turn a shade of blue.

Day by day.


Month by month.


It took a gentle hand to come out from her rock.


It was the day.


On the third month.


That a smile appeared,


While under your arm.


 

The chains were long gone.

Even though the smiles came back.


Your conscience, also was a recurring fight.


The idea that someone like you had a rightful conscience.


But it was there.


It had always been.


Clouded away by the love of kin.


You see her now eating bread.


Laughing at the T.V, motioning you over with a hand.


Then you look around.


Basement and all.


The pink walls you colored to mask the actions.


The actions that were there.


What have you done.


A slave you made.


A child no more.


A puppet no less.

As you sit down.


Again once more.


You think things could be worse.


With her mother the whore.


Both of you laugh.


Laugh with delight.


At the tapes you kept collected.


For a rainy night.

Things wouldn't continue like this.


That you knew.


They would come back.


Suspicions abrew.


So they did.


A month later on.


They took her away.


Her shrieking once more.


Though in the love of her dad.


Who she knew would be locked away.


But this was best.


You had it coming.


You were just thankful for the love.


That would never die.


"Unconditional love."

Sweat came down.


Drip by drip.


you walk upstairs.

forever you thought.
